root_causes: Per-cell validation uses range(x,0,1) (allowing only 0/1) but the expected logic shows each sub-question has a distinct answer code (HidScrQs_1 -> 1, HidScrQs_2 -> 2, ..., HidScrQs_15 -> 15). The current check will incorrectly flag valid values or miss invalid ones if the expected codes are the per-subquestion codes.
No handling of special codes (97, 98, 99) was implemented; if those codes should be treated as valid/missing exceptions they are not accounted for.

The expected logic specifies display only in test mode (isTest()). The script uses qTesting = 1 which may be correct, but this should be confirmed as equivalent to isTest(); if not equivalent, the test-mode gating will be incorrect.
instructions: Adjust the per-cell validation to match the expected answer codes for each sub-question. Replace the generic range(x,0,1) check with explicit checks for each variable. For example: IF (qTesting = 1 AND NOT MISSING(HidScrQs_1) AND NOT (HidScrQs_1 = 1)) flag = 1. Repeat similarly for HidScrQs_2 (allow only = 2), ... HidScrQs_15 (allow only = 15).

If the intended valid values include special codes (97, 98, 99) or 0/1 as valid, explicitly include them in the allowed set. For example: NOT (HidScrQs_1 = 1 OR HidScrQs_1 IN (97,98,99) OR HidScrQs_1 = 0) depending on expected policy.

Confirm that qTesting = 1 is the correct test-mode indicator equivalent to isTest(). If the canonical function/variable is isTest(), use that or ensure qTesting is set reliably. Gate all test-only checks with the correct test-mode condition.

Ensure the consistency check against HidScrQsCnts_1 remains but uses the same interpretation of sub-question values (i.e., if sub-questions are coded 1..15, compute sum accordingly or compute count of non-missing/selected responses consistent with expected coding).

root_causes: Script flags missing HidScrQsCnts_1 as an error even though question attribute NotRequired=true (missing should be allowed).
Entry-condition uses qTesting = 1 instead of the expected isTest() function (possible mismatch of test-mode check).
instructions: Do not flag missing values. Change the first validation selection to only check out-of-range values when the field is present, e.g. sel if qTesting = 1 and (not miss(HidScrQsCnts_1) and ~range(HidScrQsCnts_1,0,15)).
If the expected entry condition is isTest(), replace qTesting = 1 with isTest() (or otherwise confirm that qTesting = 1 is the correct test-mode indicator in the dataset).
Keep the consistency check with sum(HidScrQs_1..HidScrQs_15) but ensure it also only runs in test mode (it already uses qTesting = 1) and only when HidScrQsCnts_1 is present (already implemented).

root_causes: Code requires every sub-question value to be present when S7_1 > 0 (if (miss(x) ...) triggers). Expected logic marks the block NotRequired, so cells should not be forced present — only validated when supplied.

Sum calculation uses raw sub-question values and will include special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) in the numeric sum. The expected CompareNum3D/AutoSum behavior normally excludes or treats special codes separately, so special codes must not be counted toward the numeric total.

Range validation currently uses ~range(x,0,999) and is applied even when the cell is missing. Should only validate numeric range for non-missing entries, and allow special codes (97/98/99) if they are valid codes.
instructions: Do not force presence of every sub-question. Change the per-cell validation to only check values when the cell is non-missing. Replace the existing condition 'if (flt = 1 and (miss(x) or ~range(x,0,999))) flag = 1.' with something like: 'if (flt = 1 and not miss(x) and not (range(x,0,999) or x = 97 or x = 98 or x = 99)) flag = 1.' This ensures missing cells are allowed but supplied values are validated.

Exclude special codes from the sum-equals check. Create temporary _valid versions of each sub-variable that zero out special codes >=97 before summing. Example pattern: 'compute A1x1_51_v = A1x1_51. if not miss(A1x1_51_v) and A1x1_51_v >= 97 A1x1_51_v = 0.' Repeat for each sub-item, then 'compute sumA1x1 = sum(A1x1_51_v, ... , A1x1_9_v)'. Use this sum for the equality check against S7_1.

Ensure the range check allows either a numeric 0..999 OR the special codes 97/98/99. The suggested condition in instruction #1 implements this. If there are separate open-text companion variables for 'Other', also validate presence of that text when the numeric code for Other is selected.
After implementing the above, keep the column-mask behavior (only run checks when S7_1 > 0) as already implemented (flt variable), and use 'not miss(S7_1)' when performing the sum-equals comparison.

root_causes: Per-cell presence enforced when S7_2>0 (checks miss(x) as error) even though question attribute NotRequired = true — cells should not be forced non-missing.
No handling for special codes (e.g. 97/98/99). The script rejects values outside 0..999 and will flag legitimate special codes instead of allowing/excluding them from the numeric range and sum.
Sum calculation does not exclude special codes. If special codes are allowed they must not be included in the numeric sum comparison to S7_2.
No check implemented for 'Other' open-text (OpenText = true). If A1x2_9 is used/kept, the corresponding open-text variable should be validated (presence or length) as required by the form logic.
instructions: Do not require every cell to be present. Change the per-cell range check to only validate when the cell is non-missing. Replace: if (flt = 1 and (miss(x) or ~range(x,0,999))) flag = 1. With: if (flt = 1 and not miss(x) and ~range(x,0,999)) flag = 1. This permits blank cells when NotRequired = true.

Allow and specially-handle special codes (97,98,99). Modify the per-cell validation to accept these codes as valid exceptions. Example condition: if (flt = 1 and not miss(x) and not (x in (97,98,99)) and ~range(x,0,999)) flag = 1.

Exclude special codes from the numeric sum used for comparison to S7_2. Compute a numeric-only sum by mapping special-code cells to 0 before summing. Example: compute vA1x2_51 = (A1x2_51 in (97,98,99))? 0 : A1x2_51. Repeat for all cells, then compute sumA1x2 = sum(vA1x2_51, ...). Use that sum for the equality check against S7_2 and delete the temporary v-variables afterwards.

Add validation for the 'Other' open-text field associated with A1x2_9 (if present). If A1x2_9 is non-missing and indicates an 'Other' response, require the corresponding text variable (e.g., A1x2_9_txt) to be non-missing/non-empty. Example: temporary. sel if flt=1 and not miss(A1x2_9) and A1x2_9 > 0 and miss(A1x2_9_txt). list respid A1x2_9 A1x2_9_txt.

Optional: Ensure the column-mask logic matches MaskSec2Cols().isect(set("2")).size() > 0 by keeping flt = 1 only when S7_2 indicates the column applies (you currently use S7_2>0 which is acceptable if that is the intended meaning). If the mask should be driven by a different flag variable, replace the S7_2>0 condition accordingly.

root_causes: Generated check flags missing values even though the question is NotRequired (optional). The expected logic marks the count as NotRequired, so missing should be permitted.
Validation should only enforce range on non-missing values for an optional field.
instructions: Do not treat missing as a validation failure. Replace the current selection condition so the range check only runs when the value is present.
Change the sel if to: sel if isTest() and ( NOT miss(HidScrQsCnts_1) and ~range(HidScrQsCnts_1,0,999) ). This will allow missing (optional) values but still catch out-of-range numeric values.
Keep the test-mode restriction (isTest()) and the numeric bounds (0..999) as-is unless different bounds are required by the instrument.
